file_content.text: Thanks to you, the slaves in the jungle are no longer a threat to Lord Baras, my lord.
Ah, my lord--you've returned. I take it many slave captains have died this day.
They won't be bothering Lord Baras anymore.
Indeed.
Are you surprised, Imperial?
You doubted?
Oh, I--I didn't mean to doubt you. Please take no offense.
Their next of kin won't be able to identify them.
In unspeakable ways.
I shudder to imagine their fate.
My lord, you're back. Did you find sufficient proof that the slave captains are selling their people back into slavery?
Were you foolish enough to doubt me?
You wonder?
N--no, of course not, my lord. Not once.
The slave captains kept log books.
They wrote it all down.
Of course I did. I'm the best.
Most impressive, my lord. I can see why Lord Baras has such faith in you.
Now I can threaten to expose the truth. If the slave captains don't want to be torn limb from limb, they'll stop blackmailing Lord Baras.
I must say, my lord, it's been inspiring to watch you work.
I'm sure it has.
No doubt.
You've been very helpful, Commander.
You did your duty well.
Thank you, lord. I'm pleased to hear that.
Prostrate yourself elsewhere, Imperial.
Don't kiss up.
I'm sorry if I've angered you.
I'll inform Lord Baras that the situation has been handled.
Lord, I still wait for you to kill enough of the slave captains to get them to stop blackmailing Lord Baras.
Lord, I still wait for you to return with proof that the slave captains are selling their people to the black market.
Commander Pritch--at your service, my lord. Lord Baras informed me you'd be paying us a visit. I'm prepared to offer full assistance.
News travels fast.
You're ready for me, huh?
Lord Baras is nothing if not efficient. Let me follow his lead, and bring you up to speed.
Aren't you a good little soldier?
You're full of enthusiasm.
Lord Baras has always found me so, lord.
What brings me to this forsaken forest?
Why am I here?
Permit me to update you on the situation here.
There's been much unrest in these parts recently, my lord--capped off by a violent slave revolt that has the surrounding jungles overrun with armed slaves.
You can't deal with upstart slaves?
Are you ill-equipped?
The slaves have been giving the forces sent to deal with them fits. I'm not part of that duty, my lord.
Then they're not slaves anymore, are they?
They broke their bonds.
I stand corrected, my lord--former slaves.
Armed slaves. How daunting.
Sounds trifling.
They've proven to be more tenacious than you'd expect, my lord.
What no one knows is that Lord Baras orchestrated the insurgence to disrupt one of his rivals--and he wants his involvement kept secret.
Now the slave captains who led the revolt are threatening to expose Baras's involvement unless they receive more potent weapons.
Continue, Commander.
And?
Slaves, they're never satisfied.
They're getting greedy.
I'd just be happy if you took this stupid shock collar off.
I'm not interested in your happiness.
Keep dreaming.
I'll take it under advisement.
Perhaps.
But then I couldn't do this.
[Shock Vette]
Yaah! F--fine! Forget I mentioned it!
I see you know how to handle slaves, my lord.
Having been a slave for a period of time, I'd say that's an understatement.
You'd think they'd know better than to blackmail a Sith Lord.
They must be killed.
Then they leave us no choice.
That is in sync with my instructions.
Lord Baras wants you to kill enough of the blackmailing slave captains to make the others lose their resolve.
I'll kill every one I see.
They die.
Present company excluded, I hope.
If you're lucky.
We'll see.
Sure glad I've been liberated.
Maybe you'd like me to put that shock collar back on.
That can change.
You have nothing to worry about, Vette.
You're safe.
[Ignore her]
Of course, that will work as well, my lord.
I need coordinates.
Is there another solution?
Well, I suppose. Many of the slave captains are former criminals with ties to the underworld.
In fact, some have been selling their fellow slaves to the black market. If their followers found out, they'd be furious.
If I had proof that they're selling their own people back into slavery, I could blackmail the slave captains to stop blackmailing Lord Baras.
What kind of proof?
Proof?
Blackmailing blackmailers sounds poetic.
That's hopeful.
I bet they keep records of their transactions. If you rifle the slave captains' footlockers and find proof, I'll do what I can to use it against them.
Just tell me where to look.
Where is their camp?
There's no guarantee that will work. I'll just kill them.
I prefer definitive action.
Yes, it does seem like a lot of extra trouble.
It's worth a try.
Sounds like a plan.
However you want to deal with it, my lord.
The slave captains have their home base around the unfinished colossus.
I'll await any proof you salvage from the slave captains' belongings.
Forget it--seems like a lot of trouble.
Not worth it.
Whatever you decide, my lord. Killing them would be simpler.
The slaves are scattered throughout the area, but the captains tend to congregate near the unfinished colossus. I'll wait here for your return.
Takes guts to sit here and wait, don't you think?
This is his post, Vette.
He's on duty.
Pretty cushy. All I'm saying.
Take it up with the commander. I'm sure he'd appreciate the constructive criticism.
Tell him that.
No, I think I'll let him live in shame.
Not another word.
Shut up.
No disrespect, but I can't be of service right now. I've got my hands full watching over the jungle.
